Last Published: 2019-08-19  | Version: 12-aspen-SNAPSHOT

Summary

Tag Name: af:validateDateRestriction>
Type: oracle.adf.rich.DateRestriction

Validate that the date is valid with some given restrictions.

This validator provides hints for the help framework, which cannot be turned off.

This validator also runs on the client (implements org.apache.myfaces.trinidad.validator.ClientValidator).

Code Example(s)

This is an example of how to create a custom error message:

<af:validateDateRestriction 
  messageDetailInvalidDaysOfWeek="You entered {1}, which is on a {2}" invalidDaysOfWeek="Mon"/>
<af:inputDate id="days" value="#{bean.date}"
              label="Select a date, but check possible holidays first">
  <af:convertDateTime pattern="yyyy-MM-dd"/>
  <af:validateDateRestriction invalidDays="#{bean.date.nationalHolidays}" />
</af:inputDate>

<af:inputDate id="month" value="#{bean.date}"
              label="Select a date, but not within November or December">
  <af:convertDateTime pattern="yyyy-MM-dd"/>
  <af:validateDateRestriction invalidMonths="Nov Dec" />
</af:inputDate>

<af:inputDate id="daysOfWeek" value="#{bean.date}"
              label="Select a date, but not a Monday">
  <af:convertDateTime pattern="yyyy-MM-dd"/>
  <af:validateDateRestriction invalidDaysOfWeek="Mon"/>
</af:inputDate>

Attributes

Name Type Supports EL? Description
disabled boolean Yes Default Value: false

Whether the validator should be disabled, default to false.
hintInvalidDaysOfWeek String Yes

Hint message to be used, when giving a hint on the not allowed weekdays.

Parameters:
  • {0} the not allowed weekdays
hintInvalidMonths String Yes

Hint message to be used, when giving a hint on the not allowed months.

Parameters:
  • {0} the not allowed months.
invalidDays org.apache.myfaces.trinidad.model.DateListProvider Yes To specify a concrete List of Dates, use the invalidDays attribute and wire it to a DateListProvider implementation. This returns a list of dates, which are invalid.
invalidDaysOfWeek String[] Yes Specify the weekdays which are invalid for your use case. The attribute takes whitespace delimited list of weekdays. Possible values are sun, mon, tue, wed, thu, fri, sat.
invalidMonths String[] Yes Specify the month which are invalid for your use case. The attribute takes a whitespace delimited list of months. Possible values are jan, feb, mar, apr, may, jun, jul, aug, sep, oct, nov, dec.
messageDetailInvalidDays String Yes

The detail error message to be used for constructing faces messages, when input value falls within the list of restricted dates as specified by the invalidDays attribute.

Parameters:
  • {0} the label that identifies the component
  • {1} value entered by the user
  • {2} the invalid date
Please note: Parameter {1} which specifies the value entered by the user, should never be used in the message if the value is secure, like when secret=true on inputText.
messageDetailInvalidDaysOfWeek String Yes

The detail error message to be used for constructing faces messages, when input value falls within the list of restricted days as specified by the invalidDaysOfWeek attribute.

Parameters:
  • {0} the label that identifies the component
  • {1} value entered by the user
  • {2} the invalid weekday
Please note: Parameter {1} which specifies the value entered by the user, should never be used in the message if the value is secure, like when secret=true on inputText.
messageDetailInvalidMonths String Yes

The detail error message to be used for constructing faces messages, when input value falls within the list of restricted months as specified by the invalidMonths attribute.

Parameters:
  • {0} the label that identifies the component
  • {1} value entered by the user
  • {2} the invalid month
Please note: Parameter {1} which specifies the value entered by the user, should never be used in the message if the value is secure, like when secret=true on inputText.
